docTitle.titlePart: Statement on Episcopal Church Decision on Birth Control

doc.headNote: When the Tuscan Daily Citizen contacted Sanger about the Episcopal Church decision to endorse birth control when used in "Christian Conscience," Sanger gave the following statement.

docBody.head: Mrs. Sanger Lauds Birth Stand of Episcopalians
docBody.p: Contacted at her home, 65 Sierra Vista, Mrs. Sanger said, "This is the way we expect a church of intelligence and responsibility to act. Naturally, I am very pleased.

"The importance to the nation and the world by the Episcopal Church's action can't be underestimated. I am especially glad to see that the church's convention goes on record to recommend government assitance (on birth control information) when it is officially sought by other nations.

"This is the action we need," Mrs. Sanger added. "When India asked the U.S. for information on birth control, former President Eisenhower wouldn't touch it. He was wrong. Public education of all kinds, especially in this crucial matter, is certainly a part of our government's responsibility."
